The securing of weapons should be the responsibility of the owners. The community shouldn't care how the weapons are secured, but if an accident occurs as a result of the weapons being unsecure, the owner should be responsible. 
 
 No, trigger locks should not be mandatory.

Securing your firearm from unwated use is smart.
 
 Passing a law requiring trigger locks is dumb.
 
 The trigger lock sold with my AR-15 is defeated by taking a pencil and pushing in a pin that holds the guard in place. Then simply slide off. Buddy once forgot his trigger lock key at the range and simply removed it with that method.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Trigger Locks
